conclusion: Internal energy change from state A to C is 200 J; internal energy is proportional to temperature.
Use the formula ΔU = nC_vΔT for internal energy change.
Number of moles n is approximately 0.011 moles; C_v is (3/2)R.
Substitute values into the equation: 200 = 0.011 × (3/2) × 8.314 × ΔT.
Temperature at state A is -73°C or 200 K.
Calculate temperature at state C: T_C = 200 K + 1465.5 K = 1665.5 K.
Convert to Celsius: T_C = 1665.5 K - 273.15 K = 1392.35°C.
Final answer: Temperature of gas at state C is approximately 1392.35°C.
